overview: Laurence Pearl is Professor of Crystallography and Chairman of the Section of Structural Biology at the Institute of Cancer Research, Chester Beatty Laboratories in Chelsea. He began his research career at Birkbeck College working with Sir Tom Blundell, and after postdoctoral research at ICR Sutton, started his own laboratory at UCL in 1989, becoming Professor of Structural Biology in 1996. He joined ICR in 1999, where his laboratory studies the structural biology of DNA repair, signal transduction and molecular chaperones. He is a Trustee of the ICR, a scientific advisor to Abingworth, an elected member of EMBO, a Fellow of the Academy of Medical Sciences, and a Fellow of the Royal Society.
